授業目的: The purpose of this course is to acquaint those who have not majored in economics at the undergraduate with the basic microeconomic principles.
到達目標:
Students will be able to understand
1. How consumers and firms make economic decisions to achieve their objectives,
2. How market mechanism works under different market structures, and
3. How economic efficiency can (or cannot) be achieved in market economies.
授業方法:
According to the textbook, I will explain the basic theories of microeconomics. Using simple models, figures and data. I try to develop intuitive explanations for the students to deepen their understanding of economics in general.
* Classes will be conducted face-to-face.
* The students are expected to read the textbook chapters in advance.

第1回: Introduction and purpose of the course
第3回: Chapter 2: The analysis of consumer demand
第5回: Chapter 3: The analysis of production costs
第7回: Chapter 4: Analysis of firm's supply decision
第8回:
Chapter 5: Demand, supply and price determination
Discussion Session & Quiz 3
第12回:
Chapter 8:Analysis of monopolistically competitive markets
Discussion Session & Quiz 5
